reviews.review: Cool coop game!

Demons. Guns. Survival. Explosions. One badass guy at the end. How could you not want to play a game called KILLING Floor. Killing demon zombies is sweet. Guns are sweet. This game is sweet.
Besser als...

Killing Floor ist ein sehr spaßiger wellenbasierter Coop-Zombieklone-Shooter! Das Ziel ist es die Wellen erfolgreich zu meistern und zu überleben um dann in der letzten Welle sich den Patriarchen (EndBoss) zustellen! Zwischen den Runden gibt es eine Shopingtime (basiert auf den Schwierigkeitsgrad), wo man sich Waffen kaufen kann. In Killing Floor gibt es schon einige Waffen, wie z.B. der Klassiker "die AK" oder auch skurille Waffen wie "ein Kettensägeblatt-Armbrust"! Es gibt 6 verschiedene Klassen, die alle ihre eigenen Boni haben und auch ihre eigenen Klassenwaffen. DIese kann man unabhängig von den anderen Klassen hochleveln bis auf die Stufe 6 (dies kann schon eine Zeit dauern). Auch anzumerken sind die herausfordende Schwierigkeitsstufen. Der Unterschied zwischen "Einfach" und "Normal" sind gewaltig und machen mit den richtigen Team sehr viel Spaß!

Seit einigen Updates ist nun auch ein "Story"-Spielmodus vorhanden, indem ihr einige Aufgaben bewältigt und nebenbei einige Zombieklone abschießt. Die Aufgaben variieren je nach der Karte und können auch sehr schwierig sein.

Fazit: Killing Floor läuft auf der Unreal-Engine und läuft wohl auch auf älteren Rig flüssig, bietet dafür auch eine "outdatet" Grafik. (Noch Anzumerken ist das Doppel-Rendering der Scopes). Es bietet sehr viel Spaß in Coop und hat auch einen lustigen Humor, macht aber in Single-Player nicht sehr viel Spaß. Also definitiv ein Coop-Shooter! Es macht für 18 Euro sehr viel Spaß und es gibt auch Events, wo neue Spielmodi/Maps erscheinen! Sucht euch paar Freunde und kauft es euch oder wartet bis es im Angebot ist!

Crumpets/10

Probably one of my favourite games of all time. I've been yet to find a game that can properly replicate the grim and oppressive tone this game provides in it's artstyle and gameplay philosophy, it's a game that won't try to hold your hand, if your team messes up for even a second it's game over but in a way that rarely feels cheap or like something you had no way of dealing with, your death is nine out of ten times your own fault. On top of it's laser focus gameplay the weapons and gore, while nothing state of the art or perfect are designed in such a way to give the player immediate satisfying feedback this combined with enemies having 
 a focus on being heavy hitters over bullet sponges makes every bullet feel like it counts. 

That being said no game is perfect and Killing Floor is no exception, while the guns are satisfying there is an overall lack of variety in what weapons are viable, this can lead to gameplay becoming potentially stale as time goes on. On top of that one of the DLC weapon packs is objectively overpowered giving you access to cheap incendiary flare pistols that do massive damage even when used off perk and the Buzzsaw Bow which gives the melee centric perk a ranged option that does massive damage with potentially INFINITE ammuntion. Additionally this game has wildly inconsistent hit boxes that only sometimes actually match up to the Specimen's actual head and is one of the few things in this game that can actually screw you over regardless of how well you're doing. Lastly this game is just plain old and while this comes with the usual issues of a limited and often times elitist remaining player base, it also comes with the issue of the game running poorly on newer hardware ( this really depends on what hardware you're running I can run it just fine but some of my friends have complained of frame drops, missing textures or just not even being able to run it at all due to an upgrade, though certain things will crash your game or cause issues no matter your hardware).

In conclusion Killing Floor is a spectacular horde shooter with satisfying gunplay, challenging gameplay and a downright evil tone. But suffers from lack of variety and old age.

Fun for those who loved COD Zombies! It allows you to have the same feel and is challenging as well. The difference is really is that; You cant run, you can only purchase weapons between rounds, and there is no perks. It is almost like COD zombies and Counter-strike had a mutant baby.

This is a fantastic game. The Specimens are really well designed and the perk system makes it really rewarding. The achievements are challenging and some even unlock skins and weapons,all for a low price of 9.99

Игра вам либо очень нравится и вы вникаете в ее с головой, либо нет. Мне понравилась сама идея выжывания, понравилась прорисовка оружия (не даром один из жанров игры "Gun Porn"). Сам вкус игры чуствуется на 2х последних сложностях, НО туда не стоит соватся дабы не портить впечетление от игры себе и людям, пока не прокачаете пару-тройку специализаций на максимальный 6й уровень! В игре очень важно чтобы каждый отыгрывал свою роль в команде (плохо смотрится медик с большим количеством убийств). Благодаря игре познакомился с очень неплохими и дружелюбными ребятами, они меня многому научили за что им огромное спасибо!

Piove, l'atmosfera è lugubre.
Con i pochi compagni di squadra rimasti entrate in una stazione di polizia deserta e cominciate a barricarvi all'interno. L'agitazione e la paura sono nell'aria mentre preparate le vostre armi. Sentite rumori angoscianti al di fuori delle porte: urla disumane, ruggiti, lame che raschiano il terreno e grida capaci di farvi saltare la testa. Arrivano.
Preparate il dito sul grilletto e prendete la mira mentre le mostruosità all'esterno si abbattono sulla porta davanti a voi.
Non c'è via di scampo, bisogna eliminarli tutti o morire nel tentativo.
Benvenuti in Killing Floor.
Kill fuckind mutants and get the FUN!

One of the best survival horror co-op games and one of my favorites. You basically survive and kill waves of different types of specimens until you get to the boss, Patriarch. There are different classes you can play as, which specialize in specific weapons. The harder difficulties definitely need good team work and it can get really hectic, but it is incredibly fun with friends...

Killing Floor is an intense FPS that has you teaming up with 5 other players to defeat waves of various zombie-like creatures. What makes this game stand out from your typical co-op survival horror endeavor is how uninique the monsters you face are. There are about a doxen different kinds of enemies you will face, each one with their own set of specific attacks and personality. They are more akin to the horrors you'd encounter in Dead Space or Silent Hill than a typical L4D-like zombie shooter. 

There are several specialty classes players can choose from such as Commando and Medic. These classes all have their own unique set of stat boosts that level as you play them and weapons that are available to buy. 

While I sometimes question if Killing Floor is worth $20, it is a no-brainer to buy for any survival-horror co-op fan that has a group of friends to play with (and when said game is on sale).
fun zombie game best with friends
Big guns, bad guys, zombies, hotties, bullet time... What else ?
A classic. L4D is overrated, this is where it's at.

Довольно часто придя с работы, учебы или с иного мероприятия хочется немного выпустить пар и без лишних размышлений пострелять в кого-нибудь. И вот игра Killing Floor как раз из этой серии.
Сюжет игры довольно прост - ученый генетик стал проводить эксперименты по клонированию и создал армию зомби. Проведя опыты и над собой он смог стать особенно сильным, устойчивым и опасным и решил вместе со своей армией зомби захватить Великобританию. Ваша задача - уничтожить его и его армию. Действия в игре очень просты: Вас и вашу команду (если играете по сети) высаживают на захваченный участок территории и вы отбиваетесь от волн зомби. Каждая волна - это более мощная (более опасные виды зомби) атака, от которой вам необходимо отбиться. Между атаками открывается магазин - в нем вы можете купить любое необходимое вам оружие. А самая последняя волна - это тот самый ученый, которого вам необходимо убить. Самая прелесть и интерес игры в том, что есть огромное количество разного оружия и типов игрока - можно играть берсерком (атаковать оружием ближнего боя (катаны, топоры, ножи, мачете)), огнеметчиком, гранатометчиком, снайпером, медиком и техником. При использовании оружия данного типа игрока вы получаете бонусы к мощности, количеству патронов и другим характеристикам оружия и персонажа. Так же можно вместе с командой занять оборону и отбиваться от орд зомби (у игрока имеется сварочный аппарат, чтобы заварить дверь и держать оборону в помещениях). 
Движок игры не очень тяжелый и многие компьютеры потянут эту игру. Мультиплеер и одиночная игра сделаны одинаково. В общем - играть просто, легко и интересно. Тем кто любит пристрелить кого нибудь на ночь - милости просим.

With over 700 hundred hours logged in this game you could say I'm a fan. This is easily one of my favourite games of all time. That being said I might be a little biased. This is my kind of game, team based shooter that requires little to no communication. It can help but is not needed if everyone knows their job. There are classes in the game which each get perks for certain weapons. There is a samll learning curve. But with a "small" effort you can learn quickly. This is not a run and gun shooter, though it is compared with left 4 dead. It has little in common outside of zombies and co-op. Instead of running to a escape point. Like in left 4 dead. You find a defendable loction and hold out through waves of zombies. Which makes the game more about the guns than the maps. Which I prefer. Guns are pruchaesed at random  trader location on the map between waves. There are 4, 7, and 10 wave games. And a boss fight at the end with a enemy called, The Patriarch. A roid raging psycho with a rocket lancher a chain gun, and the ability to cloak himself. The game is not without it's flaws. Zombies can get stuck on the environment or in spawn points. Slowing the pace of, or all togather stopping the game. But the minor flaws are out shined by the addicting gamplay. With an almost mmo style class system requiring a balanced team to work  in harmony to achieve the oldest of goals. Zombie killing.

Okay, bad way to start off a recommendation, but whatever. If you haven't played this game yet, it's essentially a game dedicated entirely to Horde Mode. Fight waves upon waves of different types of specimen (stop calling them zombies, if you have been calling them zombies), until you come across the almighty "father" of these creatures, the Patriarch. Rinse and repeat on another map.

What helps make each match different would be how everyone else plays, as there are multiple perks (classes) to choose from in the game. The more you play as these perks, the better the stats for those perks become. But be prepared to do a lot of grinding to even level up. It's not so bad in the early levels, but as you rank higher, it requires more to get to the next level. The best way to explain that is with this example: You're a level 3 Commando, and you just inflicted a total amount of 1.5 million damage with assault rifles. Congrats, but you haven't killed 2000? Stalkers, so you don't get to rank up until you kill more Stalkers. If you play the game casually like I do, it's going to feel like forever until you get into the higher levels, as a head's up. I'll let you be the judge on whether or not that kind of leveling system is good or not.

If you haven't heard yet, this game is famous (or imfamous) for its dialogue. It's so bad, but in a good way. Think of it as like a cheesy B-movie of sorts. Considering that this is an independent game and has the feeling of a B-movie anyways, I think this is okay. Even I come back to quoting some stuff, from time to time.

One thing I especially need to mention is that this game is heavily supported by the community, in terms of custom maps, mods, and even dedicated servers. Don't believe me? Check out the Steam Workshop for this game, and you'll see how big the community's support for the game is.

Oh yeah, did I mention this game is essentially Horde Mode? Yep, only game mode, so if you're not a fan of it, don't play this game. However, if you're alright with it, I recommend playing this game with friends. This game is meant to be for a group of six people, so you know what to do. Also, this game does tend to go on sale a lot for cheap, so to be honest, I would wait until a sale pops up before buying the game.

What call of duty zombies should have been. Killing floor takes the best of COD Zombies mixing it with Counter Strike gameplay and giving you mass amounts of replayability and customization leaving you with hours of fun and exhilarating gameplay. I highly recommend this to any fps or zombie fans.
Like Nazi zombies only with more challenge.

SOME HUGE PITFALLS YOU SHOULD BE AWARE OF!
1. If you join a pub server, chances are your FRAME-RATE IS CAPPED  to 90 fps,
which shows up at around 88 max in the game!
There is nothing wrong with your performance or internet!!
It’s a server side command which can be overridden by host:
Default “MaxClientFrameRate=90.000000”
Frame-rate is uncapped (unrestricted) when playing Solo or Hosting a (Listen) Server yourself,
but default setting for clients is a capped frame-rate of 90 (88) fps!
2. In most cases “port forwarding” is required if you want your friends to join your “custom” match,
but you can always meet up and control a pub server via the vote menu with your crew.
3a. Don’t ever use V-SYNC in-game, or force it via a video-driver control panel!
It might function properly for a couple of sessions but eventually it will bug out and create a micro stutter, or even cap your frame-rate at a much lower number than your refresh-rate! *
4. UNTICK “Reduce mouse lag” (ENABLED BY DEFAULT!!!) because it has an incredible impact on your performance. It reduces my (uncapped) frame-rate with 40%!!!
5. The 3d 9.0 (=DX.9) renderer has the best performance!
6. Increase “CacheSizeMegs from 32 to 256 (if you have more than 1 GB of Ramm )
in your Killing Floor.ini under [Engine.GameEngine] section.
Location: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\KillingFloor\System
7. Disable those ridiculous loud, over the top, advertisements in the lobby:
Location: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\KillingFloor\Movies
Rename all movies.
8. Check out the steam workshop for some great add-ons, mods, maps etc!
(But installing (subscribing) to these is not a flawless process yet!
You might want to consider installing them the old fashion way. 
9. Familiarize yourself with the (white-listed) mutators:
http://kf-wiki.com/wiki/List_of_whitelisted_and_greylisted_mutators

* 3b. If you don’t like playing with an uncapped frame-rate find a way to cap it besides using v-sync!
I have done so with my “frame-rate target control” inside my Radeon Settings control panel.
Capping my frame-rate at anything above 100 fps gives me a very silky smooth experience on my 60 Hz monitor and makes the game very responsive!
122 fps seems to be my sweet spot, but the difference is hardly noticeable above 100 fps.

Just take note that a framerate(cap) under 100 fps feels very jerky in this game!!!
And with the default command of “MaxClientFrameRate=90.000000” and a buggy v-sync,
this is just a recipe for disaster!
Probably also the reason everybody thinks this game is broken!
But it’s not!
It's majestic!

Ever wanted a more gorey left 4 dead, with more people? Well this game suits that bill, with many good maps made by the devs, and hundreds made by the community. The zombies have amazing designs, and the patriach is a brilliant idea. Also, all the voice actors for the characters (of which there are loads) are British. Although it has its flaws and bugs, like trying to set up a game is too hard, and I often end up halfway through the floor. 8/10, should play.

This is the second best zombie FPS game there is. And the best of the best of wave/horde killing games.

- Fight off hords of zombies and fight the final boss in the final wave
- There are about 6 classes, each of them with progression bonuses
- At the end of each wave you go to the shop and buy weapons and/or change your class
- There alot of skins in the DLC's, but i would stick with the golden weapon DLC's
- The soundtrack is just amazing, Heavy Metal and Trash Metal for the win
- The graphics are a bit below average, but that's because it's an unreal engine 2 game

Este é o segundo melhor FPS jogo de zumbi que existe na minha opinião. E o melhor do melhor de Ondas / hordas.

- Lutar contra hordas de zumbis e lutar contra o boss final na última onda.
- Há cerca de seis classes, cada uma delas com bônus de progressão
- No final de cada onda você deve ir até a loja para comprar armas e / ou mudar a sua classe
- Há um monte de Skins na DLC, mas eu prefiro as DLC com armas Gold
- A trilha sonora é simplesmente fantástica, Heavy Metal e Trash Metal
- Os gráficos estão um pouco abaixo da média, mas isso é porque é um jogo com a Unreal Engine 2

Pretty generic FPS with some horror elements. No real rhyme or reason to the plot, and the characters have no depth. Multi-class selection lets you specialize with specific weapon types which can be purchased from a post-round "Trader" NPC. Custom servers can be fun, but any of them that host more than a dozen players get boring as there are not enough mobs to go around and the gameplay is way to hectic.

2.5/5 Stars
LODSOFEMONE

Wave制のサバイバルゾンビFPSゲーム。
7つのパークから1つを選択し、Waveごとに出現する敵を仲間と殲滅していき、最後まで生き残れることが目的だ。
戦略性の高いゲームのなのでゲームクリアのためのセオリーを参加プレイヤーが覚えておかないとクリアは難しい。最低でも、敵の数が少なくなる前に店の場所へ移動して殲滅後に装備を購入、次のWaveが始まる前に迎撃する位置まで移動を完了することと、孤立しないことを覚えておくといい。後半に出現する強い敵に戦況をひっくり返されたり、最弱の敵につかまれて動けなくなるなど、このゲームは絶妙なバランスを持っている。
また、このゲーム以外では味わえないものに射撃感の良さがある。心地良い射撃感に続いて発動するZEDは快感の一言に尽きる。夏やハロウィン、クリスマスにイベントが行われ、マップも豊富だ。FPSが好きなら面白いゲームなので買っても損は無い。

First person zombie hoard game with very tight controls, some nice maps and fun voice acting. You can't go wrong with playing this with a few mates, or online with a few random people for a few hours. Custom maps are incredibly dodgy and buggy for the most part though. Enjoy those head shots!

Killing Floor, Is one of those rare games where even if the grapics are a bit out dated, okay a lot out dated, its still worth $20. BE WARNED: This game is very bloodey, they really didn't hold it back at all, DO NOT PLAY WITH KIDS AROUND. Think of Killing Floor this way. Take Left 4 Dead, add some Call of Duty: Nazi Zombies, add some Dead Island Zombie types, and you have Killing Floor. There really isn't a story to this game, there is objective mode, but I didn't really like it that much. But even through the out dated GFX and Not so good Objective Mode, This game is worth your $20.

Starting out as a mod for Unreal Tournament it expanded into it's own game. And we were lucky that happened. 

Upon starting the game and getting right to the Zed killing your character is this cute looking military guy called Corporal Lewis. Watching him and the other characters "run" is one of the more amusing animations in this game. They kind of waddle. 

While the graphics are sorely dated at this point, it's the gameplay that keeps people coming back. Up to six squad members battle it out to kill the most Zeds to earn money to upgrade weapons. But you have to work as a team in order to make it to the boss round and win. There are a large variety of Zeds. From the small but quick Crawlers to the large and slow Bloats (think Boomer from Left 4 Dead). They all attack differently and you have to be prepared for it or you could end up dead lickity split. 

There are two Zeds however that stand out. The Fleshpound (think the Tank) and the Scrake (not like the Charger but kind of close). These two are extremely powerful and take certain perks (loadouts) to kill. Then there is the boss, the Patriarch. It takes all your ammo and your squads ammo to really take him down which makes it very satisfying when you do. 

Another great addition to this game were holiday events the devs would release. So in the summer they had a "Summer Sideshow" event a couple of times where you got new achievements and maps to unlock and circus Zeds to fight. Then there were Halloween events with their own set of achievements and maps and Halloween Zeds and lastly Christmas events.

Fun gameplay, has awesome holiday events that transform the enemies and locales to fit either the 4th of July, Halloween or Christmas. Plus has the villain who needs a hug the most.

Good game. Graphic desgin is not bad and it is almost same as Left 4 Dead (L4D) and Call of duty: World of End (COD5) as Nazi Zombies because it has survival and horde wave... but it is a little different... it allows 4-6 players in group play in one game. I'm enjoying this game but not the best. They desgined this game to allow  others enjoy to play. Also, you can add mods with different cool things on weapons. So you should try this game and I hope u will enjoy the game.

The first time I played this game, it really brought me back to the call of duty zombies experience, but better. Killing Floor adds alot of varity of weapons and classes. Like if  you wanted to be a guy that blows these specimans away with a shotgun theres a class for that. And with these classes, you can level up and adding growth to the game and not just killing specimans mindlessly without getting a reward out of it. Also when you get at the very end of the waves, you have to fight a huge boss speciman and you and your teamates have to gang up on him to defeat him. I strongly reccomend this game to people that like to fight hordes and hordes of zombie like creatures, and becoming stronger in the process.

Любите мясо? Или хотите просто развеяться? А так же много много много стрелять? - Тогда это игра для вас!!
Потрясающая игра в стиле Horror team survival shooter (короче стрелялька в стиле ужасов и выживания) с уже слегка устаревшей графикой (игрушка уже древняя древняя) и адреналиновым геймплеем и отличным тяжелым саундтреком подстать геймплею.

P. S. 
Моя личная оценка 5 из 5, игрушка зацепила, играю уже как минимум 3 года.
